description: Removal of monitoring part of Condition 6 (Energy Strategy) following planning permission 00549/K/P1 (P/2022/1613) dated 03/01/2023 for demolition of existing garages and the erection of seven flats with associated amenity space, cycle storage, landscaping, five car parking spaces (of which two are blue badge bays) and wider community improvements.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Time limit

The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 3 January 2023, being the date of granting of planning permission P/2022/1613.

Reason: To accord with the provisions of Section 92 (1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - In accordance with approved drawings

The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (3667-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-101001 P1, 3667A-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-110000 P3, 3667-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-101000 P3, Arboricultural Impact Assessment Report, Design and Access Statement, Daylight & Sunlight Report, Construction Logistics Plan, Preliminary Tree Survey Report and Panning & Heritage Statement. Received on 26 May 2022; Transport Statement. Received on 20 June 2022; Drainage Assessment Form, Flood Risk and Surface Water Drainage Assessment, Flood Risk Checklist, Noise Impact Assessment and Preliminary Groundwater Screening Assessment. Received on 24 June 2022; Sustainability Report Rev. B. Received on 14 July 2022; 3667A-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-600006 P1. Received on 11 October 2022; 3667A-LB-XX-00-DR-A-120000 P8, 3667A-LB-XX-00-DR-L-20000 P4, 3667A-LB-XX-00-DR-L-210000 P1, 3667A-LB-XX-01-DR-A-120001 P7, 3667A-LB-XX-02-DR-A-120002 P7, 3667A-LB-XX-03-DR-A-120003 P7, 3667A-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-140000 P2 and 3667A-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-30000 P2. Received on 5 December 2022; Proposed Elevations 01 and 3667-LB-XX-ZZ-DR-A-1300001 P4 (Proposed Elevations 02). Received on 21 December 2023) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Reason: To ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - Materials

The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the materials approved under P/2023/1326.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.
Condition : 4 - Boundary treatment

Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development the boundary treatment shall be erected in strict accordance with the approved plans. The works shall thereafter be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and area.
Condition : 5 - Hard and soft landscaping

The landscaping details shown on the submitted plans and documents shall be carried out as approved, prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development.

The works shall comply with the requirements specified in BS 3936 (1992) 'Specification of Nursery Stock Part 1 Trees and Shrubs', and in BS 4428 (1989) 'Recommendations for General Landscape Operations'. Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation.

The landscaping works shall thereafter be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and to promote biodiversity.
Condition : 6 - Energy strategy

The development hereby permitted shall be implemented in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Reason: In order to ensure the development meets sustainability standards.
Condition : 7 - Water efficiency

Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources.
Condition : 8 - Sustainable sourcing of materials

The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:

At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.

At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.

No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Reason: In the interests of sustainable development.
Condition : 9 - Construction Logistics Plan

The development shall take place in accordance with the details contained within the approved Constructions Logistics Plan under P/2023/2354.

Reason: In order to ensure highway safety is maintained and preserved and to safeguard the amenities of adjoining residential properties.
Condition : 10 - Hours of demolition and construction

No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8 am to 6 pm on Mondays to Fridays and 9 am to 1 pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Prior to any demolition and construction work, neighbours shall be given details outlining construction timeframes (including when demolition and piling will take place).  

Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents.
Condition : 11 - Mechanical services noise control

a)	The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the mechanical system etc operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 meter from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142; An alternative position for assessment /measurement may be used to allow ease of access, this must be shown on a map and noise propagation calculations detailed to show how the design criteria is achieved.
b)	The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter.
c)	Following installation of any mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014(Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments. The post completion report shall be both completed and submitted to the local authority within 28 days of completion of the installation for review.

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions.
Condition : 12 - Wheelchair user dwellings

No less than two Wheelchair User Dwellings, built to Building Regulations M4(3)(2)(B) standards, shall be provided in accordance with the approved plans. These dwellings shall be retained as such for the duration of the development.

Reason: In order to ensure that the development complies with inclusive design principles.
Condition : 13 - Parking spaces

Prior to the occupation of the hereby approved development the five parking spaces as shown on the approved plans numbered 3667A-LB-XX-00-DR-A-120000 P8, 3667A-LB-XX-00-DR-L-20000 P4 and 3667A-LB-XX-00-DR-L-210000 P1 (of which no less than two are disabled persons Blue Badge spaces) shall be implemented in accordance with the approved plans and shall thereafter be retained as such for the lifetime of the development, without obstruction.

Reason: In order to ensure that sufficient parking spaces are made available.
Condition : 14 - Cycle parking

Prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved, full details (including manufacturer's specifications) of secure, covered, cycle parking facilities (for not less than 12 bicycles) for the occupants of the development and short stay cycle parking facilities (for not less than two bicycles) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction. 

Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 15 - Delivery and servicing plan

Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a Delivery & Servicing Plan (including details of vehicle access and egress arrangements and times that servicing shall take place) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall accord with current guidance such as that issued by TfL and include measures required to ensure sufficient arrangements (physical as well as managerial) for the servicing, including refuse collection, of all aspects of the development, the timing of hours for deliveries by motor vehicles and a timetable for implementation. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details and shall be maintained for the lifetime of the development, unless the prior written approval of the local planning authority is obtained to any variation.

Reason: In the interests of the safety of pedestrians and vehicles, to protect neighbours' living conditions and to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 16 - Waste management strategy

Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development a waste management strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show how waste will be managed on site specifically on waste collection days. Waste management shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In order to protect the quality of the local environment and neighbours' living conditions and to ensure appropriate means of refuse storage are provided.
Condition : 17 - Wider improvements

Prior to first occupation of the hereby approved development, the parking spaces (for no less than 13 new car parking spaces including a car club space), highway safety measures (consisting of double yellow lines, footpaths, dropped kerbs and tactile paving), remaining bin enclosures and collection points, within the Hampton Road Estate shall be carried out as approved under P/2023/1325, in their entirety.
The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details, without obstruction and maintained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that there are adequate servicing facilities within the wider area and in the interests of highway safety.
Condition : 18 - Transport mitigation measures (CPZ Consultation and car club membership)

Before the development hereby approved is first occupied, the developer shall have entered into a binding agreement with the Council that will secure a suitable contribution to: 
A.	A car club membership for all residents, for the period of three years, including driving credits for the first occupiers of the development and;
B.	An estate wide consultation for the possible implementation of an estate wide controlled parking zone, with future residents of the proposed development restricted from obtaining parking permits.

Should a controlled parking zone be implemented, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the proposed dwellings so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.

Reason: In order to protect the free flow and safety of traffic in the area and nearby highways to support sustainable transport objectives.
Condition : 19 - Contamination

A.	The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application: P/2023/0805, approved on 24/04/2024. 

During the course of the development:

B.	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. 
Before the development is first brought into use:
C.	Any necessary scheme for decontamination required by either clauses B) or C) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Reason: Contamination is known or suspected on the site due to a former land use. It is therefore necessary to ensure that the development can be implemented and occupied with adequate regard for public and environmental safety.

Supporting Notes:
(i)	The full Phase II site investigation, where required, must include sampling and/or testing for soil and groundwater contamination, soil gasses, vapours and leachate and test for potential contaminants identified within the Phase I Preliminary Risk Assessment. 
(ii)	The investigation shall be carried out at such points and at such depths as the local planning authority may stipulate. 
(iii)	Testing for Total Hydrocarbons shall be undertaken using the TPH-CWG method. Where significant contamination is identified, to fully characterise the site the extent of this contamination should be confirmed by further intrusive site investigation and testing (i.e. delineation works). 
(iv)	Risk assessments must adhere to current UK guidance and best practice. 
The Council requests that site investigation reports or site plans be sent electronically to landq
Condition : 20 - Drainage design

The drainage system and associated drainage features approved under P/2023/2387 shall be carried out in strict compliance with the approved details.

Reason: In order to prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site.
Condition : 21 - Built in accordance with drainage details

No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and copies of installation contracts, along with a written confirmation) has been submitted to the local planning authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme hereby approved has been completed in accordance with the submitted final detailed drainage designs. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.

Reason: In order to ensure that the methods to mitigate the risk of surface water flooding have been implemented as agreed and that the drainage system is suitably managed.
Condition : 22 - Design Out Crime

The Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve 'Secured by Design' accreditation awarded by the Design-Out Crime Officer from the Metropolitan Police Service on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO).

No dwelling shall be occupied until accreditation has been achieved and evidence of such accreditation has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing.

Reason: In pursuance of the Council's duty under section 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998.
Condition : 23 - All Non-road Mobile Machinery (NRMM)

All Non-road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) used during the course of the development that is within the scope of the GLA 'Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition' Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) dated July 2014, or any successor document, shall comply with the emissions requirements therein.

Reason: In the interests of air quality and to protect neighbours' living conditions and the wider local environment.
Condition : 24 - Noise mitigation

The hereby approved development must be carried out in accordance with the recommendations of the approved Noise Impact Assessment received on 24 June 2022 and comply with the requirements of BS 8233:2014 to provide sound insulation against externally generated noise with good acoustic design of the building envelopment and a means of ventilation provided.

Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted post completion noise tests shall be carried out by accredited/approved organisations in order to demonstrate that this has been achieved. The test reports shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The measures shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of residential amenity.
Condition : 25 - Obscure windows

The windows hereby approved to the rear walkways of the approved development shall be obscure glazed and non-opening below 1.7 metres above internal floor level. The windows shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than in accordance with the requirements of this condition.

Reason: To safeguard the visual amenities of the locality and to protect neighbours' privacy.
Condition : 26 - No use as winter gardens or amenity space

The enclosed rear walkways hereby permitted shall not be used as winter gardens or a similar amenity area, nor as part and parcel of any unit(s).

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and the appearance of the area.
